messages.message:
So while we’re a little over on pace, I’d expect us to be at closer to 60%, and we’re at 75% we are indeed on an enterprise agreement now that has pre negotiated overage prices.

If we expect current levels to maintain we should factor that into the new agreement.

Generally speaking on a one year contract, we want to see us snugged as tight as we can on utility for price where overages kick in after the halfway mark in the year, which is what we’re seeing here, so I think we’re in good shape.
we can turn on auto-cancellation for cypress ci if cost is a concern, especially once it's blocking, as a single failure should cause the whole job to fail anyway
if auto-cancellation is on, from a single CI run, frontend devs may not know all the tests that fail bc of their PR, right?
that experience may be frustrating for frontend devs… but we can remember this as an option if cost becomes a big concern

(I’ll let this conversation continue without adding comment, but anything that limits our test load through checks would be ideal and should be explored for cost control purposes, that said, it should not disrupt use)

this also doesn't help _too_ much, since in the Ideal World we'd expect all tests to pass anyway. we could also try to be more specific about which tests to rerun (right now our method for determining what tests to rerun is very coarse), and we can also try to make our tests run faster
I'm monitoring this. cc @Ashish will discuss this with you in our 1:1
